thread.title: Cross country: Belleville athletes shine in Essex County Class Invitational
thread.title_full: Cross country: Belleville athletes shine in Essex County Class Invitational

title: Cross country: Belleville athletes shine in Essex County Class Invitational
text:
Buy this photo Photo Courtesy of Joanne Campione-Porecco From left, Danny Guerra, Ilce Perez, and Allison Diaz stand with their medals following their performances last weekend at the Essex County Class Meet. 
The Bucs will prepare for the County championship meet, set for Oct. 30, at Brookdale Park, in Bloomfield. The NJSIAA state sectional championship race is the following Saturday, Nov. 7, in Morris Plains. 
Belleville coach Joanne Campione-Porecco was pleased with her team's effort last week. 
"Our team made a lot of progress this week," the coach said. "We had some kids with personal best times, as well as athletes who earned medals in the race." 
In the freshman race, the Belleville girls were led by Camillah Nigatu, who ran 15:43. Koryn Versola (17:29) and Nancy Vu (20:47) also ran well for the Bucs. The freshman boys were paced by Julian Roca (17:15) and Sebastian Paez (20:01). 
In the sophomore girls' race, Ann Maria Albert ran a personal best for the Bucs, with a time of 25:23. Also finishing with a personal best in that race was Chiarize-Crish Bulusan, who finished in 29:22. Andrea Romero (27:30) and Christa Cordeiro (37:10) turned in good efforts, as well, for the Bucs. 
Arik Odre had a personal best time of 22:13 in the boys' race while Joshua Uceta (24:27) had an excellent race. 
Ilce Perez continued her outstanding season for the Bucs in the junior race, running a personal best time of 23:59 and garnering a medal for her 21st place finish. 
In the boys' junior race, personal best times were turned in by Daniel Castano (19:49) and Mayck Calle (20:59) on the Branch Brook Park course. 
More medals and personal best times for the Bucs came in the senior race. For the girls, Allison Diaz ran a personal best of 24:31 and won a medal, as well. Danny Guerra had a personal best of 19:45 and also gained a medal in the boys' race. Also running well for the boys was Mark Tarazona (20:10, a personal best) and Armando Calado (20:26).
